intro: Pinalia velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf pinalia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Pinalia velutina is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
